docs.abstract: Via photographs, recipes, art, a podcast interview and more, students use The Times to explore the history, traditions and significance of the holiday.
docs.snippet: Via photographs, recipes, art, a podcast interview and more, students use The Times to explore the history, traditions and significance of the holiday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Are you looking for ways for your students to learn more about Juneteenth? Below we offer five teaching ideas for exploring the holiday and its significance via a variety of media, including photographs, recipes, art and a podcast interview.

headline.main: Five Ways to Learn About Juneteenth With The New York Times

docs.abstract: In this stylish documentary, young men discuss their country’s laws criminalizing gay sex.
docs.snippet: In this stylish documentary, young men discuss their country’s laws criminalizing gay sex.
docs.lead_paragraph: The documentary “The Legend of the Underground” captures queer Nigerian activists as they discuss their country’s laws criminalizing gay sex. Together, they lament unjust arrests and police brutality. But they are not aiming for either martyrdom or altruism — instead, their goal is to improve the circumstances of their own lives.

headline.main: ‘The Legend of the Underground’ Review: Gay Activism in Nigeria

docs.abstract: The annual awards recognized journalism on the murder of George Floyd, including a special citation for Darnella Frazier, the teenager who filmed the killing. The public service prize went to The New York Times for Covid coverage.
docs.snippet: The annual awards recognized journalism on the murder of George Floyd, including a special citation for Darnella Frazier, the teenager who filmed the killing. The public service prize went to The New York Times for Covid coverage.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pulitzer Prizes were awarded on Friday to news organizations that provided in-depth coverage of the dramatic turns of 2020, a year dominated by a pandemic that left millions dead and a national conversation on race after the murder of George Floyd.

headline.main: Pulitzer Prizes Focus on Coverage of Pandemic and Law Enforcement
headline.print_headline: Pulitzers Focus on News Coverage of Pandemic and Racial Justice

docs.abstract: Crème and Cocoa Creamery survived the pandemic. But like many small businesses in New York, its future is hardly secure.
docs.snippet: Crème and Cocoa Creamery survived the pandemic. But like many small businesses in New York, its future is hardly secure.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is here at last, the summer of possibility. New York City has been flung open. The evenings have grown long and sultry. Block parties are happening, sidewalks are buzzy. Joy subsists on the chance to roam, to linger.

headline.main: A Brooklyn Ice Cream Shop and the Make-or-Break Summer Ahead
headline.print_headline: It’s the Summer of Make or Break

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Creme and Cocoa Creamery (Brooklyn, NY, Retailer)

docs.abstract: Periods, prisons, political division and poetry. Teenagers tackle these issues and more in these 16 runners-up essays.
docs.snippet: Periods, prisons, political division and poetry. Teenagers tackle these issues and more in these 16 runners-up essays.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here are the 16 runners-up in our Eighth Annual Student Editorial Contest. They join 10 winners and 26 honorable mentions as our favorite essays of the 11,202 we received this year.

headline.main: Runners-Up From Our 8th Annual Student Editorial Contest

docs.abstract: A statue of British imperialist Cecil Rhodes at Oxford University has drawn criticism for decades. Now some academics said they would refuse to teach at the college where the statue sits.
docs.snippet: A statue of British imperialist Cecil Rhodes at Oxford University has drawn criticism for decades. Now some academics said they would refuse to teach at the college where the statue sits.
docs.lead_paragraph: A long-running controversy at Oxford University over a statue of Cecil Rhodes, the British imperialist seen by many as an architect of apartheid in South Africa, gained new momentum this week after more than 150 academics said they would refuse to teach students of the college where the monument sits.

headline.main: Scholars at Oxford University Refuse to Teach Under Statue of Colonialist

docs.abstract: The author, 98, wrote one of the classic novels of Depression-era Black life, “Daddy Was a Number Runner,” and its themes still resonate today.
docs.snippet: The author, 98, wrote one of the classic novels of Depression-era Black life, “Daddy Was a Number Runner,” and its themes still resonate today.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Louise Meriwether reflects on her childhood in Harlem, she remembers running around, jumping rope and hanging out with her friends on rooftops, where they would occasionally dare one another to leap from building to building.

headline.main: It’s Not Too Late to Discover Louise Meriwether
headline.print_headline: A Novel From ’70 Is Still Resonant

docs.abstract: George Gascón is facing an intense backlash for enacting the sorts of policies demanded by protesters after the killing of George Floyd.
docs.snippet: George Gascón is facing an intense backlash for enacting the sorts of policies demanded by protesters after the killing of George Floyd.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — From inside the walls of Folsom State Prison, the two inmates, one a convicted murderer, clinked their cups of prison moonshine in a toast to the new district attorney of Los Angeles, George Gascón.

headline.main: Los Angeles Just Elected a Liberal D.A. He’s Already Facing a Recall Effort.
headline.print_headline: D.A. on the Left In Los Angeles Faces a Revolt

docs.abstract: Their plan to appear together over the last weekend before the primary, appears aimed at creating a bloc against the presumed front-runner, Eric Adams.
docs.snippet: Their plan to appear together over the last weekend before the primary, appears aimed at creating a bloc against the presumed front-runner, Eric Adams.

headline.main: Yang and Garcia Announce Plans to Campaign Together
headline.print_headline: Yang and Garcia Plan To Join Forces for a Day On the Campaign Trail

byline.original: By Michael Gold, Jeffery C. Mays and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

docs.abstract: Culture wars, fueled by Fox News-style provocation, have arrived in France.
docs.snippet: Culture wars, fueled by Fox News-style provocation, have arrived in France.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — It’s become a familiar refrain in French political life. From President Emmanuel Macron and his cabinet to the far-right opposition, from print columnists to talking heads, “Americanization” is increasingly held responsible for a whole set of social ills ailing the nation.

headline.main: France Is Becoming More Like America. It’s Terrible.
